when_to_say: When referring to the door of a building or room.
example: ドアを開けてください。(Doa o akete kudasai) - Please open the door.

when_to_say: When talking about a window in a house or building.
example: 窓から外を見ました。(Mado kara soto o mimashita) - I looked outside through the window.

when_to_say: When referring to the roof of a building.
example: 屋根が赤いです。(Yane ga akai desu) - The roof is red.

when_to_say: When talking about the walls of a house or room.
example: 壁に絵があります。(Kabe ni e ga arimasu) - There is a picture on the wall.

when_to_say: When referring to the kitchen of a house.
example: キッチンで料理をします。(Kitchin de ryouri o shimasu) - I cook in the kitchen.

when_to_say: When talking about a bedroom in a house.
example: 寝室で本を読みます。(Shinshitsu de hon o yomimasu) - I read a book in the bedroom.

when_to_say: When referring to the living room of a house.
example: 居間でテレビを見ます。(Ima de terebi o mimasu) - I watch TV in the living room.

when_to_say: When talking about a bathroom in a house.
example: 浴室でシャワーを浴びます。(Yokushitsu de shawaa o abimasu) - I take a shower in the bathroom.

when_to_say: When referring to the balcony of a house or apartment.
example: バルコニーで花を育てています。(Barukonii de hana o sodateteimasu) - I grow flowers on the balcony.

when_to_say: When talking about a garage in a house.
example: ガレージに車を停めます。(Gareeji ni kuruma o tomemasu) - I park the car in the garage.

when_to_say: When referring to a book used for reading or studying.
example: 私は毎晩本を読みます。(Watashi wa maiban hon o yomimasu) - I read a book every night.

when_to_say: When referring to a writing instrument.
example: 赤いペンを使います。(Akai pen o tsukaimasu) - I use a red pen.

when_to_say: When referring to a notebook for writing notes.
example: ノートに名前を書きます。(Nooto ni namae o kakimasu) - I write my name in the notebook.

when_to_say: When referring to a desk used for studying or working.
example: 机の上に本があります。(Tsukue no ue ni hon ga arimasu) - There is a book on the desk.

when_to_say: When referring to a blackboard in a classroom.
example: 黒板に文字を書きます。(Kokuban ni moji o kakimasu) - I write letters on the blackboard.

when_to_say: When referring to school assignments to do at home.
example: 宿題を忘れないでください。(Shukudai o wasurenaide kudasai) - Don't forget your homework.

when_to_say: When referring to an educator or instructor.
example: 教師は生徒を教えます。(Kyoushi wa seito o oshiemasu) - The teacher teaches the students.

when_to_say: When referring to someone who is learning.
example: 生徒は一生懸命勉強します。(Seito wa isshoukenmei benkyou shimasu) - The student studies hard.

when_to_say: When referring to a test or examination.
example: 試験の準備をしています。(Shiken no junbi o shiteimasu) - I am preparing for the exam.

when_to_say: When referring to a place for studying or reading books.
example: 図書館で静かにしてください。(Toshokan de shizuka ni shite kudasai) - Please be quiet in the library.

when_to_say: When referring to bread as a food item.
example: 朝ごはんにパンを食べます。(Asagohan ni pan o tabemasu) - I eat bread for breakfast.

when_to_say: When referring to cooked rice or a meal.
example: ご飯を炊きます。(Gohan o takimasu) - I cook rice.

when_to_say: When referring to Italian-style noodles.
example: 夕食にパスタを作ります。(Yuushoku ni pasuta o tsukurimasu) - I make pasta for dinner.

when_to_say: When referring to the fruit apple.
example: リンゴをひとつ食べました。(Ringo o hitotsu tabemashita) - I ate one apple.

when_to_say: When referring to cheese as a food item.
example: チーズはピザに使います。(Chiizu wa piza ni tsukaimasu) - Cheese is used in pizza.

when_to_say: When referring to meat as a food item.
example: この肉はとても柔らかいです。(Kono niku wa totemo yawarakai desu) - This meat is very tender.

when_to_say: When referring to a dish made of raw or cooked vegetables.
example: サラダにドレッシングをかけます。(Sarada ni doresshingu o kakemasu) - I put dressing on the salad.

when_to_say: When referring to a liquid dish made by boiling ingredients.
example: スープを温めてください。(Suupu o atatamete kudasai) - Please heat the soup.

when_to_say: When referring to a dessert made from flour, sugar, and other ingredients.
example: 誕生日にケーキを食べます。(Tanjoubi ni keeki o tabemasu) - I eat cake on my birthday.

when_to_say: When referring to fish as a food item.
example: 新鮮な魚を買いました。(Shinsen na sakana o kaimashita) - I bought fresh fish.

when_to_say: When talking about mountains or hiking.
example: 美しい山に登りました。(Utsukushii yama ni noborimashita) - I climbed a beautiful mountain.

when_to_say: When referring to a flowing water body.
example: 川で魚を釣りました。(Kawa de sakana o tsurimashita) - I caught fish in the river.

when_to_say: When talking about dense woods or forests.
example: 森の中で迷いました。(Mori no naka de mayoimashita) - I got lost in the forest.

when_to_say: When referring to the sky.
example: 空が青いです。(Sora ga aoi desu) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: When talking about the ocean or sea.
example: 夏に海に行きます。(Natsu ni umi ni ikimasu) - I go to the sea in summer.

when_to_say: When talking about the sun in the sky.
example: 太陽が昇っています。(Taiyou ga nobotteimasu) - The sun is rising.

when_to_say: When referring to the moon in the night sky.
example: 月が明るいです。(Tsuki ga akarui desu) - The moon is bright.

when_to_say: When referring to rainfall.
example: 今日は雨が降っています。(Kyou wa ame ga futteimasu) - It is raining today.

when_to_say: When referring to flowers.
example: 花が咲いています。(Hana ga saiteimasu) - The flowers are blooming.

when_to_say: When referring to stones or rocks.
example: 庭に大きな石があります。(Niwa ni ookina ishi ga arimasu) - There is a big stone in the garden.

when_to_say: When referring to air travel or an airplane.
example: 飛行機で東京に行きます。(Hikouki de Toukyou ni ikimasu) - I will go to Tokyo by airplane.

when_to_say: When referring to a travel ticket.
example: 駅で切符を買いました。(Eki de kippu o kaimashita) - I bought a ticket at the station.

when_to_say: When referring to staying overnight at a hotel or inn.
example: この旅館に宿泊します。(Kono ryokan ni shukuhaku shimasu) - I will stay at this inn.

when_to_say: When referring to baggage or luggage.
example: 荷物を持ちました。(Nimotsu o mochimashita) - I carried the luggage.

when_to_say: When referring to a physical or digital map.
example: 地図を見ながら歩きます。(Chizu o minagara arukimasu) - I walk while looking at the map.

when_to_say: When talking about exploring or visiting places.
example: 京都で観光を楽しみます。(Kyouto de kankou o tanoshimimasu) - I enjoy sightseeing in Kyoto.

when_to_say: When referring to a travel passport.
example: パスポートを忘れないでください。(Pasupooto o wasurenaide kudasai) - Don't forget your passport.

when_to_say: When referring to a train or bus station.
example: 駅で友達に会いました。(Eki de tomodachi ni aimashita) - I met a friend at the station.

when_to_say: When talking about a bus as a mode of transport.
example: バスで学校に行きます。(Basu de gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school by bus.

when_to_say: When referring to cars or driving.
example: 車を運転します。(Kuruma o untenshimasu) - I drive a car.

when_to_say: When referring to a work-related meeting.
example: 会議は午前１０時に始まります。(Kaigi wa gozen juuji ni hajimarimasu) - The meeting starts at 10 a.m.

when_to_say: When referring to a coworker or colleague.
example: 同僚と一緒にランチを食べます。(Douryou to issho ni ranchi o tabemasu) - I eat lunch with my colleague.

when_to_say: When referring to a place where one works.
example: 職場は駅の近くにあります。(Shokuba wa eki no chikaku ni arimasu) - My workplace is near the station.

when_to_say: When referring to your superior at work.
example: 上司に報告します。(Joushi ni houkoku shimasu) - I will report to my boss.

when_to_say: When referring to someone who reports to you at work.
example: 部下がプロジェクトを完成させました。(Buka ga purojekuto o kansei sasemashita) - My subordinate completed the project.

when_to_say: When talking about earnings from a job.
example: 給料日は来週です。(Kyuuryoubi wa raishuu desu) - Payday is next week.

when_to_say: When referring to job responsibilities or shifts.
example: 彼は夜間勤務をしています。(Kare wa yakan kinmu o shiteimasu) - He works the night shift.

when_to_say: When referring to someone's occupation.
example: 彼女の職業は教師です。(Kanojo no shokugyou wa kyoushi desu) - Her profession is teaching.

when_to_say: When talking about a rest or break during work.
example: 午後３時に休憩します。(Gogo sanji ni kyuukei shimasu) - I take a break at 3 p.m.

when_to_say: When referring to an agreement or contract.
example: 新しい契約にサインしました。(Atarashii keiyaku ni sain shimashita) - I signed a new contract.

when_to_say: When referring to a medical facility.
example: 病院で診察を受けました。(Byouin de shinsatsu o ukemashita) - I had a check-up at the hospital.

when_to_say: When referring to medication or drugs.
example: この薬を飲んでください。(Kono kusuri o nonde kudasai) - Please take this medicine.

when_to_say: When referring to a medical health examination.
example: 健康診断は毎年受けています。(Kenkou shindan wa maitoshi uketeimasu) - I have a health check every year.

when_to_say: When referring to physical activity or exercise.
example: 運動を毎日するのは大事です。(Undou o mainichi suru no wa daiji desu) - Exercising every day is important.

when_to_say: When referring to eating or having a meal.
example: 規則正しい食事を心がけています。(Kisoku tadashii shokuji o kokorogateiteimasu) - I aim for regular meals.

when_to_say: When referring to taking a break or resting.
example: 休息が必要です。(Kyuusoku ga hitsuyou desu) - Rest is necessary.

when_to_say: When referring to a medical professional.
example: 医者に相談してください。(Isha ni soudan shite kudasai) - Please consult a doctor.

when_to_say: When referring to a healthcare professional who is a nurse.
example: 看護師が注射をしました。(Kangoshi ga chuusha o shimashita) - The nurse gave me an injection.

when_to_say: When referring to dietary or nutritional intake.
example: 栄養バランスが大切です。(Eiyou baransu ga taisetsu desu) - Nutritional balance is important.

when_to_say: When referring to physical or medical symptoms.
example: 風邪の症状があります。(Kaze no shoujou ga arimasu) - I have cold symptoms.

when_to_say: When referring to a device for computing.
example: 新しいコンピューターを買いました。(Atarashii konpyuutaa o kaimashita) - I bought a new computer.

when_to_say: When referring to automated machines or robots.
example: そのロボットは話すことができます。(Sono robotto wa hanasu koto ga dekimasu) - That robot can talk.

when_to_say: When referring to the global network of computers.
example: インターネットで情報を探します。(Intaanetto de jouhou o sagashimasu) - I search for information on the internet.

when_to_say: When referring to a smartphone device.
example: スマートフォンで写真を撮りました。(Sumaato fon de shashin o torimashita) - I took a photo with my smartphone.

when_to_say: When referring to digital or statistical information.
example: このデータを分析します。(Kono deeta o bunseki shimasu) - I will analyze this data.

when_to_say: When referring to a coded application or software.
example: 新しいプログラムを開発しました。(Atarashii puroguramu o kaihatsu shimashita) - I developed a new program.

when_to_say: When referring to mechanical devices.
example: その機械は非常に便利です。(Sono kikai wa hijou ni benri desu) - That machine is very convenient.

when_to_say: When referring to AI systems.
example: 人工知能が私たちの生活を変えています。(Jinkou chinou ga watashitachi no seikatsu o kaeteimasu) - Artificial intelligence is changing our lives.

when_to_say: When referring to electronic gadgets.
example: このデバイスは最新の技術です。(Kono debaisu wa saishin no gijutsu desu) - This device uses the latest technology.

when_to_say: When referring to a connected system of computers or devices.
example: ネットワークが切れています。(Nettowaaku ga kireteimasu) - The network is down.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of soccer.
example: 彼はサッカーチームに所属しています。(Kare wa sakkaa chiimu ni shozoku shiteimasu) - He belongs to a soccer team.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of baseball.
example: 野球を観戦するのが好きです。(Yakyuu o kansen suru no ga suki desu) - I enjoy watching baseball.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of basketball.
example: 毎週末バスケットボールをします。(Maishuumatsu basukettobooru o shimasu) - I play basketball every weekend.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of tennis.
example: 彼女はテニスが得意です。(Kanojo wa tenisu ga tokui desu) - She is good at tennis.

when_to_say: When referring to the activity or sport of swimming.
example: 水泳は健康に良いです。(Suiei wa kenkou ni yoi desu) - Swimming is good for health.

when_to_say: When referring to track and field events.
example: 陸上大会に参加しました。(Rikujou taikai ni sanka shimashita) - I participated in a track and field event.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of volleyball.
example: バレーボールの試合を見に行きます。(Bareebooru no shiai o mi ni ikimasu) - I am going to watch a volleyball match.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of table tennis.
example: 友達と卓球を楽しみました。(Tomodachi to takkyuu o tanoshimimashita) - I enjoyed playing table tennis with my friend.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of golf.
example: ゴルフ場でプレーしました。(Gorufu jou de puree shimashita) - I played at the golf course.

when_to_say: When referring to the sport of rugby.
example: 彼らはラグビーの練習をしています。(Karera wa ragubii no renshuu o shiteimasu) - They are practicing rugby.

when_to_say: When expressing happiness or delight.
example: 彼の成功は家族に大きな喜びをもたらしました。(Kare no seikou wa kazoku ni ookina yorokobi o motarashimashita) - His success brought great joy to his family.

when_to_say: When referring to feelings of sorrow.
example: 悲しみを乗り越えるのは大変です。(Kanashimi o norikoeru no wa taihen desu) - Overcoming sadness is difficult.

when_to_say: When expressing frustration or anger.
example: 彼の怒りはすぐに収まりました。(Kare no ikari wa sugu ni osamarimashita) - His anger subsided quickly.

when_to_say: When referring to feelings of fear or anxiety.
example: 恐れを感じる必要はありません。(Osore o kanjiru hitsuyou wa arimasen) - There is no need to feel fear.

when_to_say: When expressing affection or love.
example: 彼らの愛は永遠です。(Karera no ai wa eien desu) - Their love is eternal.

when_to_say: When referring to feelings of strong dislike.
example: 彼女の態度に嫌悪を感じました。(Kanojo no taido ni ken’o o kanjimashita) - I felt disgusted by her attitude.

when_to_say: When expressing amazement or surprise.
example: そのニュースに驚きました。(Sono nyuusu ni odorokimashita) - I was surprised by the news.

when_to_say: When referring to a state of well-being or contentment.
example: 幸福は健康から生まれます。(Koufuku wa kenkou kara umaremasu) - Happiness comes from health.

when_to_say: When referring to feelings of nervousness or worry.
example: 彼は将来について不安を感じています。(Kare wa shourai ni tsuite fuan o kanjiteimasu) - He feels anxious about the future.

when_to_say: When expressing relief or reassurance.
example: 安心して寝ることができました。(Anshin shite neru koto ga dekimashita) - I was able to sleep peacefully.
